byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Turkey said it was in talks with allies including the United States about a ground war operation. American unwillingness to commit troops made prospects unlikely.

headline.print_headline: Aid Delivery Near in Syria for 5 Towns, U.N. Says
headline.main: U.N. Says Aid Delivery Near in Syria for 5 Towns

snippet: Turkey said it was in talks with allies including the United States about a ground war operation. American unwillingness to commit troops made prospects unlikely.
abstract: United Nations is still in negotiations with Syrian government over lifting of blockades in order to facilitate arrival of aide convoys,  five days after prospect of relief was announced, but assures citizens help is near.
